title: Fridge not cooling at all
symptoms: Freezer may be slightly cool or also warm
Motor/compressor may be silent or clicking
possible_causes: Start relay or overload protector faulty
recommended_actions: Verify the fridge is plugged in and outlet has power
Listen for compressor: is it totally silent or only clicking every few minutes?
Clean condenser coils thoroughly to remove heavy dust
If compressor never starts or only clicks, call a professional to test relay, capacitor, and compressor windings

title: Fridge runs but not cold enough
symptoms: Temperature in fresh food section above 45°F (7°C)
Freezer is cold but not solid hard
possible_causes: Blocked air vents between freezer and fridge compartment
recommended_actions: Unplug unit and clean condenser coils with brush and vacuum
Check that evaporator fan in freezer is spinning when door switch is pressed
Inspect door seals for gaps; replace damaged gaskets
Move food away from vents to allow good airflow

title: Freezer cold but fridge warm
possible_causes: Evaporator fan weak or not spinning
Frost clogging air channels between freezer and fridge
recommended_actions: Listen for fan noise in freezer with door open and switch pressed
Check and gently move air damper vent to ensure it can open
Defrost unit completely for 24 hours with doors open and towels to catch water

title: Fridge making clicking sound and not cooling
symptoms: Repeated clicking from compressor area every few minutes
Compressor tries to start but stops
possible_causes: Compressor drawing too much current (internal damage)
recommended_actions: Verify outlet voltage with another heavy appliance
Inspect relay/overload module on compressor for burnt smell or cracks
Replace start relay kit if visibly damaged
If new relay does not fix it, compressor may need professional replacement

title: Heavy dust on condenser coils, poor cooling
symptoms: Back or bottom coils covered in thick dust
Compressor seems to run very hot
possible_causes: Restricted heat dissipation due to dust
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge before cleaning
Use brush, compressed air, and vacuum to remove all dust from coils and fan area
Make sure fan spins freely and replace if noisy or stuck
Leave at least a few inches of space behind the fridge for airflow

title: Water leaking under fridge
symptoms: Puddle of water on floor near front or back
possible_causes: Supply line leak on models with ice maker or water dispenser
recommended_actions: Remove freezer panel and look for ice buildup near drain hole
Use warm water and a thin tube or pipe cleaner to clear drain
Inspect drain pan for cracks or overflow
Check water supply connections for drips

title: Ice buildup on back wall of freezer
symptoms: Thick ice sheet on back panel
Fan noise may get louder or start to grind
possible_causes: Control board not initiating defrost cycle
Door left open frequently allowing moist air
recommended_actions: Do a full manual defrost for 24 hours with doors open
After restart, listen if frost returns within a week
If frost returns quickly, defrost components should be tested by a technician

title: Fridge too cold, food freezing in fresh section
symptoms: Thermostat set to normal but temperature is near 0°C
possible_causes: Temperature sensor or thermostat stuck closed
Control board not reading sensor correctly
recommended_actions: Reset temperature settings to a warmer level and wait 24 hours
Check if air vent into fridge is fully open; partially close if adjustable
If temperature does not change, sensor or control board may require service

title: Loud buzzing or rattling from back of fridge
symptoms: Vibration noise especially when compressor starts
Noise may change if you push fridge slightly
possible_causes: Copper tubes touching cabinet or each other
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge and gently move copper lines so they do not touch metal surfaces
Tighten any loose mounting brackets if accessible
Inspect fan for debris or bent blades; clean and straighten carefully

title: Interior light on but fridge not running
symptoms: Light turns on when door opens
No fan noise, no compressor noise
possible_causes: Door switch stuck so system thinks door is open (on some models)
recommended_actions: Turn thermostat from coldest to warmest and back; listen for click
Unplug and re-plug after 5 minutes to reset electronics
If still dead, thermostat or board likely needs professional testing

title: Fridge constantly running, never shuts off
symptoms: Interior may be too cold or barely adequate
recommended_actions: Check door seals with paper test (paper should drag when pulled)
Clean condenser coils thoroughly
If still running non-stop with correct temperature, technician should check gas charge and thermostat

title: Bad smell inside fridge
symptoms: Strong odor even after removing old food
possible_causes: Long power outage spoiled food in hidden areas
recommended_actions: Empty fridge and wash all surfaces with baking soda solution
Flush drain line with warm water and mild bleach solution
Place open box of baking soda or activated charcoal to absorb remaining odor

title: Ice maker not producing ice
symptoms: Ice bin empty or very low
possible_causes: Water supply valve closed or kinked hose
recommended_actions: Check that water supply valve is open and line not kinked
Inspect and thaw any ice blockage in fill tube with warm air (not tools)
If water never enters tray, inlet valve may need replacement

title: Water dispenser not working
symptoms: You can hear or not hear valve click
possible_causes: Air lock or frozen line in the door
recommended_actions: Replace water filter if old or clogged
Open door and feel if water line in door feels frozen; let it thaw
Check if any child-lock function is enabled on control panel

title: Condensation and water droplets on door gaskets
possible_causes: High room humidity or frequent door openings
recommended_actions: Clean gaskets with warm soapy water and dry
Adjust door level so it closes by itself when released
Replace damaged gaskets if they do not seal

title: Freezer burning food (freezer burn)
symptoms: White dry patches on frozen food
possible_causes: Food stored too long or not sealed
Temperature fluctuates due to door openings
recommended_actions: Use airtight bags or containers for long storage
Keep freezer as full as possible but not overcrowded
Set freezer to recommended temperature (around -18°C / 0°F)

title: Noise like grinding or scraping from freezer
symptoms: Periodic grinding noise, especially when door is closed
Noise changes when you open door
recommended_actions: Open freezer and listen near fan cover
If noise stops when door is open, fan or ice is likely
Defrost unit fully; if noise returns, fan motor or blade may need replacement

title: Fridge trips breaker immediately
symptoms: Breaker trips when fridge plugged in or when compressor starts
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge immediately and do not reset breaker repeatedly
Inspect cord for visible damage
This situation requires a qualified appliance electrician

title: Display panel not responding but cooling ok
recommended_actions: Check user manual for child-lock or panel-lock function and try unlock sequence
Power-cycle fridge for 5 minutes
If still frozen, panel or board may need service but unit can temporarily operate as is

title: Strong chemical or burning smell from back
symptoms: Sharp odor when standing behind fridge
May coincide with smoke or discoloration
recommended_actions: Unplug fridge immediately
Do not continue to run unit until inspected
Call professional service; risk of fire or further damage

title: Door alarm keeps beeping even when closed
possible_causes: Magnet for sensor weak or missing
recommended_actions: Gently press around gasket to see if alarm stops
Check for broken plastic around door switch
If alarm persists, switch or sensor may need replacement

title: Fridge interior light stays on when door closed
symptoms: Top of fridge feels very warm
recommended_actions: Press door switch manually; see if light turns off
If switch feels loose or broken, it must be replaced to avoid overheating

title: Cracking or popping noises from inside fridge
possible_causes: Normal expansion and contraction of plastic liners
recommended_actions: Usually harmless if cooling is normal
Check for loose shelves or items touching walls
If noise becomes metallic or grinding, investigate fan or compressor instead

title: Strong vibration transmitted to floor
symptoms: Noise reduces when you press on cabinet
recommended_actions: Adjust feet so fridge is stable and all corners touch floor
Move fridge slightly away from walls
Use vibration pads under feet if floor is very resonant

title: Frost only on top of freezer compartment
symptoms: Top area icy, lower shelves normal
possible_causes: Items blocking door from sealing at top
Warm air entering from top corner
recommended_actions: Rearrange food so nothing touches ceiling or door
Check gasket for gaps at top
Adjust hinges if possible or replace gasket

title: Freezer door hard to open right after closing
symptoms: Door feels vacuum-sealed for a short time
After a minute it opens normally
recommended_actions: This is usually normal behavior
Wait 30–60 seconds before reopening
If door never releases or gasket tears, inspect for mechanical issues

title: Food freezing only near back wall
symptoms: Items touching back panel become icy
possible_causes: Cold air outlet directly at back
recommended_actions: Keep sensitive items away from back wall
Raise temperature setting one step and monitor
If entire section begins to freeze, sensor calibration may be off

title: Vegetable drawers full of water
symptoms: Condensation or standing water in crispers
possible_causes: Door opened very frequently in humid climate
Warm food placed directly into drawers
recommended_actions: Adjust crisper vents to lower humidity
Let hot foods cool before refrigeration
Wipe drawers dry and monitor door opening habits

title: Back interior panel bulging or warped
recommended_actions: Unplug and fully defrost fridge for at least 24 hours
If panel stays deformed or icing quickly returns, defrost system needs service

title: Condensation on exterior cabinet
symptoms: Sweating or water droplets on outside walls
possible_causes: Door gaskets leaking allowing cold bridges
recommended_actions: Use dehumidifier in room if humidity very high
Ensure doors seal well and are not misaligned
If sweating extreme on new unit, contact manufacturer

title: Ice forming on floor of freezer
symptoms: Solid sheet of ice on bottom
Water sometimes drips into fridge section
recommended_actions: Defrost unit fully and clear drain with hot water and flexible tube
Check door gasket and hinges
If ice returns quickly, drain system may need parts replaced

title: Rattle noise from inside fridge ceiling
recommended_actions: Remove shelves and inspect plastic covers for looseness
Tighten screws or clips carefully
If ice present, do a manual defrost and monitor

title: Display shows error code related to sensors
recommended_actions: Power-cycle fridge for 5 minutes
If code returns, consult manual for meaning
Sensor or board usually must be replaced by technician

title: Door handle feels loose or wobbly
recommended_actions: Tighten visible screws with correct screwdriver
For hidden screws, remove decorative caps carefully
Do not overtighten to avoid cracking plastic

title: Shelves or door bins keep cracking
recommended_actions: Spread heavy items across multiple shelves
Avoid placing glass jugs on door bins
Order replacement bins specific to model

title: Noise only when ice maker cycles
symptoms: Loud clunk or grinding when ice dumps
recommended_actions: Compare with manual description of normal sounds
If cubes distorted or ice maker jams, module may need replacement
Turn ice maker off if not needed

title: Water filter warning light on
recommended_actions: Replace filter with correct model
Reset indicator following manual (button or combination)
If flow still poor, line or valve may also be restricted

title: Door opens by itself after shutting
symptoms: Door slowly reopens a few centimeters
Happens more when fridge is full
possible_causes: Fridge slightly leaning backward or forward incorrectly
Items pushing against door from inside
recommended_actions: Level fridge so it leans just slightly backward
Rearrange tall containers away from door
Confirm gaskets are clean and sticky enough to seal

title: Random beeping with no visible error
recommended_actions: Power-cycle fridge and check that doors close firmly
Monitor temperatures with a fridge thermometer
If beeping continues daily, service may be needed

title: Temperature fluctuates widely during the day
symptoms: Thermometer reading swings up and down
recommended_actions: Group items so cold air can circulate
Avoid opening door for long periods
Place most sensitive foods deeper inside

title: Ice cubes have bad taste or odor
symptoms: Drinks taste off when using ice
recommended_actions: Throw away old ice and make fresh batch
Store foods in sealed containers
Replace water filter regularly

title: Freezer temperature okay but ice is soft
recommended_actions: Lower freezer setpoint and wait 24 hours
Check for frost only near door area (indicates gasket leak)
Avoid opening door repeatedly during hot weather

title: Fridge runs normally but display shows very wrong temperature
symptoms: Thermometer inside shows 4°C but display 10°C or -5°C
recommended_actions: Verify real temperature with separate thermometer
If difference constant, note real value and consider service when convenient
Sensor may eventually need replacement

title: Door gasket repeatedly falls out of track
symptoms: Seal pulls away when door opened
recommended_actions: Warm gasket gently with hair dryer to make it flexible and press back into track
Tighten retainer screws if present
Replace gasket if it no longer stays seated

title: Fridge makes gurgling or bubbling sounds
symptoms: Liquid flowing sounds from back or inside walls
Noise more frequent after compressor stops
recommended_actions: Usually harmless if cooling is fine
If combined with poor cooling and oily residue, there may be refrigerant leak requiring professional service

title: Fan starts and stops rapidly
recommended_actions: Listen whether pattern follows door opening/closing
Do a full defrost to remove any hidden ice
If issue persists, fan or board needs testing

title: LED interior lights flicker
symptoms: Lights flash quickly when door opened
possible_causes: Voltage regulation issue on control board
recommended_actions: Gently tap light module; if flicker changes, connector likely loose
If comfortable, remove cover and reseat plug
Otherwise schedule service; parts are usually modular

title: Fridge in garage stops cooling in winter
symptoms: Freezer warms up while fridge area seems okay
possible_causes: Unit not designed for cold environment
Thermostat senses room not needing cooling
recommended_actions: Check manufacturer spec for operating temperature
Consider garage-rated fridge or heater kit
Avoid storing critical frozen foods in non-rated units

title: Switching off power causes loud bang or click
symptoms: Noise at moment of unplugging or power cut
recommended_actions: Usually normal once or twice
If repetitive loud bangs during running, internal compressor damage may be present and needs professional check

title: Fridge door rusting around edges
recommended_actions: Clean and dry area; remove loose rust carefully
Touch up with appliance paint to slow progression
Severe structural rust may eventually require door replacement

title: Unit very hot between freezer and fridge doors
symptoms: Center mullion strip hot to touch
possible_causes: Heater strip working to prevent condensation
recommended_actions: Clean coils thoroughly
Ensure good air circulation around fridge
If strip is extremely hot, thermostat or control for heater may malfunction

title: Fridge repeatedly shuts off then on due to power saver outlet
symptoms: Unit seems to lose power randomly
Other devices on same outlet also controlled
possible_causes: Smart outlet or energy-saving strip cutting power
Generator or inverter with unstable voltage
recommended_actions: Plug fridge directly into dedicated wall outlet
Avoid using timers or smart plugs on refrigerators
Stable power is critical to avoid compressor damage

title: Water under drawers inside fridge compartment
possible_causes: Crack in liner allowing water path
recommended_actions: Remove drawers and clean channel leading to drain hole
Use warm water and soft brush to flush
If water still appears daily, liner damage may require professional evaluation

title: Alarm for high temperature after power outage
recommended_actions: Silence alarm according to manual
Check internal temperature and food safety
If unit cools back normally within a few hours, no repair needed

title: Fridge makes whooshing noise when doors close
symptoms: Air sound for a few seconds
Doors slightly harder to open immediately after closing
possible_causes: Normal pressure equalization through small vents
recommended_actions: Considered normal design feature
If noise becomes loud whistle, vents may be partially blocked

title: Inside back wall shows yellow or brown stains
possible_causes: Old refrigerant oil stain from factory
recommended_actions: If cooling is normal and stain not sticky, usually cosmetic
If accompanied by oily residue or strong chemical smell, contact service for leak check

title: Freezer making constant wind noise
possible_causes: Fan running at high speed due to warm load
Door not sealing and fan pulling extra air
recommended_actions: Check gasket for gaps with paper test
Ensure no packaging blocks air vents
Noise should reduce once temperature stabilizes

title: Fridge very old, running but using too much energy
possible_causes: Inefficient compressor and insulation compared to modern units
recommended_actions: Consider energy calculator to compare replacement payback
If major repair needed, replacement is often smarter long-term
Recycle old appliance responsibly

title: Fridge transported laying down and now not cooling
possible_causes: Oil migrated into refrigerant lines during transport
recommended_actions: Always keep fridge upright during move when possible
If it was on its side, let it stand unplugged for 24 hours before turning on
If damage already done, professional service may be required

title: New fridge making many unfamiliar sounds
symptoms: Clicks, gurgles, fan changes like never heard before
possible_causes: Normal defrost and refrigerant flow cycles
recommended_actions: Review "normal sounds" section of user manual
If sounds are not accompanied by error codes or temperature problems, they are usually normal
Record audio if noise becomes extremely loud or metallic and share with technician

title: Freezer is cold but fridge section is warm
symptoms: Freezer is making ice but fridge food feels warm
Milk or drinks in the fridge are not cold enough
possible_causes: Blocked air vents between freezer and fridge section
Evaporator fan not blowing cold air into fridge
recommended_actions: Check the vents inside the fridge and freezer and move items away from them to allow airflow
Listen for the fan inside the freezer when the door is closed — if it is silent, the fan motor may be faulty
If you see a mechanical flap (damper) between freezer and fridge, make sure it is not blocked by ice or food packaging
If airflow does not improve, call a professional to test the fan motor and damper control

title: Evaporator coils are buried in thick ice
symptoms: Back panel inside freezer has thick ice or frost
Fridge and freezer temperatures are both too warm
Fan sounds louder or air flow feels weak
possible_causes: Auto defrost system failure (heater, thermostat, or control board)
Door left open frequently causing heavy frost
Door gasket leaking warm air inside
recommended_actions: Unplug the fridge and keep doors open for 24 hours to fully defrost the ice (protect the floor from water)
After defrost, wipe and dry the inside, then plug the fridge back and monitor cooling for 24–48 hours
Check door gaskets for gaps, cracks, or dirt — clean them and make sure the door closes tightly
If heavy ice returns within a few days, ask a technician to test the defrost heater, defrost thermostat, and control board

title: Water leaking on the floor in front of the fridge
symptoms: Small puddle of water in front or under the fridge
Water appears mostly after defrost cycles or hot days
No visible leak from household water line
possible_causes: Clogged or frozen defrost drain line
recommended_actions: Pull the fridge forward and inspect the drain pan at the bottom — make sure it is not cracked and is seated correctly
Look for a small plastic drain hose coming down from the freezer area into the pan — check for clogs or kinks
If you can access the drain hole in the freezer, carefully flush it with warm water using a turkey baster or small squeeze bottle
If leaks continue, have a technician inspect the drain line and pan for hidden cracks

title: Loud rattling or scraping noise from inside the fridge
symptoms: Noise comes from inside the freezer or back wall
Sound changes when door is opened
May sound like a fan hitting something
possible_causes: Evaporator fan blade hitting ice buildup
Loose fan blade or worn fan motor
Plastic parts vibrating against each other
recommended_actions: Open the freezer and listen carefully near the back panel while the fridge is running
If the noise stops when you gently press on the back panel, there may be ice or loose parts behind it
Unplug the fridge before removing any screws or panels — do not work near live electrical parts
If you see ice on or around the fan, fully defrost the unit and check door gaskets; if noise returns, the fan motor may need replacement by a technician

title: Compressor clicks but does not start
symptoms: You hear a repeating click every few minutes from the back
Compressor feels very hot to the touch
possible_causes: Faulty start relay or overload protector
Low line voltage or bad outlet (less common)
recommended_actions: Unplug the fridge for at least 15–20 minutes to let the compressor cool
Check that the outlet is delivering normal voltage by testing another appliance
If the compressor still just clicks and never runs, the start relay/overload may need replacement
Compressor work involves high voltage and sealed refrigerant — call a professional if you are not trained

title: Fridge runs almost all the time but is still not cold enough
symptoms: Compressor and fans run for very long periods
Interior temperature is cool but not at the set point
Exterior side walls may feel warm
possible_causes: Dirty condenser coils reducing heat rejection
Room temperature very high with poor ventilation around fridge
Thermostat setting too cold, causing long run time
Door seals leaking, letting warm air in
recommended_actions: Clean the condenser coils thoroughly (brush + vacuum) and clear dust from the back and underneath the unit
Make sure there is enough space (at least a few inches) behind and above the fridge for air circulation
Check door seals by closing a sheet of paper in the door — if it pulls out easily, the gasket may need adjustment or replacement
After cleaning and adjustments, give the fridge 24 hours and recheck temperatures

title: Intermittent cooling – sometimes fine, sometimes warm
symptoms: Fridge sometimes feels perfect, other times too warm
You may notice ticking or clicking from the control area
Unit may shut off for long periods
possible_causes: Overheating compressor with internal thermal cutout
recommended_actions: Use a thermometer to log temperatures over 24–48 hours in both the fridge and freezer sections
Note the times when the compressor is not running while temperatures are high
If the unit does not restart until you tap the control area or unplug/replug, the thermostat or control board may be failing
This type of intermittent fault usually requires diagnosis by a professional technician

title: Door does not seal tightly and warm air leaks in
symptoms: Door pops open slightly after you close it
You see condensation or frost near the gasket
Paper test between door and frame feels loose
possible_causes: Shelves overloaded causing door to twist
recommended_actions: Clean the entire gasket with warm soapy water, then dry it and check for cracks or hard spots
Do a paper test around the whole door — close a paper strip in the door and see where it pulls out too easily
Reduce heavy items stored in the door bins so the door is not pulled out of alignment
If the door is visibly sagging, hinge adjustment or replacement may be needed by a technician

title: Ice maker not making ice
symptoms: Ice bin empty or very low
You do not hear water filling into the ice maker
Other parts of the fridge seem to cool normally
possible_causes: Water supply valve closed or line kinked
Ice maker arm stuck in OFF position
Defective water inlet valve or ice maker assembly
recommended_actions: Confirm that the household water supply valve to the fridge is fully open
Inspect the water line behind the fridge for kinks or damage
If your fridge has a water filter, replace it if it is older than the recommended interval
Check the metal or plastic shut-off arm on the ice maker — make sure it is in the ON position and moves freely
If there is still no water entering the ice tray, a technician should test the inlet valve and ice maker module

title: Persistent bad odor even after cleaning
symptoms: Strong smell when opening the fridge
Odor remains after removing spoiled food
Smell seems to come from plastic or insulation
possible_causes: Liquids or spoiled food soaked into hidden areas or insulation
Clogged drain pan holding dirty water
recommended_actions: Remove all food, shelves, and drawers, and wash them with warm soapy water and baking soda
Clean the interior walls with a solution of baking soda and water, then dry completely
Locate and clean the drain pan underneath the fridge if accessible
Place open boxes of baking soda or activated charcoal inside for several days to absorb remaining odors
If odor remains extremely strong, the insulation may be contaminated — in severe cases the fridge may not be economically repairable
